com.tymeac.demo

Class TyDemoInternalClientCancelled2

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tymeac.demo.TyDemoInternalClientCancelled2

  • public class TyDemoInternalClientCancelled2
extends java.lang.Object
    Tymeac demonstration system. Internal client for canceling syncReq() In order for a cancel to work, the function on the server must be delayed. Otherwise, the syncReq() would return before the cancel logic was reached. When using a Tymeac Function_4, three queues are in use. These queues use applications com.tymeac.serveruser.Demo1, ...Demo2 and ...Demo3. Put a delay in Demo3.main() such as Thread.sleep(5000). This gives the cancel logic enough time to work.

      New thread for invoking the remote cancelSyncReq() method on the Tymeac Server.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        private void init()
        The sequence is the following. -breakiterator 1. start the server 2. start the new thread for a cancel 3. send a sync request for Function_4 with a cancel word in the parm 4 the new thread calls the server with a cancelSyncReq() 5. do an overall request to see what is active in the system 6. wait 10 seconds 7. shut down the server 8. wait 10 seconds 9. shut down again

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Create a new instance and call init()

        args - java.lang.String[]
